column9: By using the voice conmmand, I don't have to put in the effort to visually identify the target. And it is especially helpful in cases where the target(s) is blocked and hard to select.
column10: 1.The voice recognition is not all always accurate and I need to go through the extra steps to deselct and put in voice command again. When it misinterpretted the same voice command several times, it made me start to question whether it will eventually get it right or not. 2. Through my interactions with the system, I have learned to speak slower than my natural speaking speed when giving voice commands, which isn't a very smooth experience for me. 3. It's seemed that I cannot make mistakes when giving voice commands. Sometime I found myself stutter and might used the wrong words, and I had to start all over again without means to make corrections. Ray cast offered more flexibility in this regard, I can deselect an object easily.
column36: It's helpful to be able to see something afar up close. It gave me a better understanding of the bigger picture and make me feel more confident that I didn't miss something.
column37: 1.Pressing the selection button didn't work a lot of times, and it was unclear to me what might be wrong. It seemed a little random when I could make a valid selection. 2. It was not intuitive to me that if I select multiple objects that are overlapping, they will apearn on outside of the grey circle. I originally thought those are additional objects in the adjacent area rather than copies of the things within the grey circle. There could be additional visual indicators to make it more clear that those are the "duplicates" appeared separately for easy selection
column38: Maybe having instructions always appear in the environment would be helpful. I.e. select using trigger/control button, then press B to finish. Sometimes I forgot which one is the right button to use at certain steps.

column66: I wish there was a confirmation step after I give voice command, i.e. the system will first show me what it recognize from my speech and ask me if it's accurate and want to proceed before making the action.
column67: Maybe the training for each technique can start before the actual test. Right now trainings for bothg are at the very beginning of the session, and we actually started with the training for technique 2. It took me some time to remember the correct steps.

column9: This technique can largely enhance the accuracy of object selection compared to gaze tracking technique.
column10: When using voice input, it sometimes identifies wrong words and thus requires very accurate pronounciation.
column11: Users with accent, such as British accent, may find it difficult to master this technique. However, for those with perfect pronounciation, this technique can significantly improve their productivity. Raycast is more complex but easier to be used for those with accent.

column9:
It is very interesting, and feels like magic to be able to see things that your torch hit expanded. 

And I notice I keep looking back and forth between my little map and the distand view, come comparing them to see where the target might lies in, it's very effective in that sense. Especially because this panel follows my left hand, and those objects remains there if I do not keep casting torch, I feel more in control.
column10:
Minimap object expansion list could appear close to left hand (or just close to the bottom in general, or let the user customize the position they want to see this mini object) in minimap. For me, the fact that this mini thing is far from my left hand means I always have to lift my head to look at it and it is not very convenient.

sometimes the minimap still put many objects close to each other, making it hard to see or tell, and sometimes I double selected two objects at once because they are basically overlaying on top of each other. 

I feel the right hand little sphere is a bit too big maybe? because in the case where there are two objects very close to each other, this sphere might select two things at the same time.
column11: Maybe there is a little bug or something, sometimes I need to press middle finger multiple times to select the object successfully, from once to six times, very unpredictable, it affected my completion time and my mood a bit.
column36:
I think when I need to select 4 objects, the voice selection is really handy and great, because it select all four for me while I do not need to move my hands much.

but when there is 1 or 2 and if they are not blocked and are visible, I like the fact that I can direct select them, it is intuitive and easy.

I feel the combination of them stroke a nice balance.
column37:
Because the voice recognition is not very accurate, especially for me, the system always confused the word SPHERE with something else (maybe because of my accent?) so it either doesnt select anything or select wrong objects, which made me gradually lose trust of the voice system, so I try to select things directly if possible.

also, I noticed I am not very farmilar with the name of a lot of objects, so I sometimes select one just to check the name and then I use the voice to select the rest of them. It will be nice if I can say “select everything like the one I have selected”, then I do not need to repeat the name, that will be nice and convenient.

also I feel for voice system, some of the names are too long, like..white patterned primid cuboid..in those case I sometimes would rather just try to find objects myself.
column38: the triggering bug is probably still there because sometimes I need to click trigger 3 times to select something, it is a bit unpredictable.
column64:
The minimap is so interesting, the way that it shows the things that the torch hit. it is magical

especially for distant objects, the minimap technique is good because for technique 2 I can not see things very clear due to the resolution limit of the headset and just the far distance of the objects.
column65: the voice is efficient when it recognize well, when it doesn't it is very annoything.
column66:
select one object and say: select all objects that look like this.

maybe the feature that allow you to walk inside the area and select? because right now so many blockings are caused by the fact that I can not move freely so the view is limited.
column67: it is actually very very hard to say which one I like the best, because I like technique 2(voice and select) that it is very efficient and effortless especailly when there are multiple objects, but I like technique 1 that it is very interesting to see things expanded on your hand, it feels magical altough it has higher cognitive demand and is not that fast and efficient.

column9: The minimap search feature is very useful, zooming in on an area with lots of shapes. This helps make the search must easier and faster.
column10: Sometimes in areas with not a lot of shapes, visually finding the shape is much quicker than using the minimap search feature. In other words, the benefits this feature brings is rather situational and may slow the search down in certain conditions (when an area doesn't have a lot of shapes).
column36: Speech recognition is very useful when there is a large quantity of shapes to select, or when there's difficulty in finding a shape, or when there's trouble selecting a shape (e.g. stacked on each other or behind another shape), or simply from fatigue after manually selecting shapes.
column37: The slight delay in starting up the system (and the time it takes to speak) may mean that it is sometimes faster to manually select shapes. This applies in cases when I only have to select 1-2 shapes, and that they are easily spottable, not stacked on or behind other shapes.
column38: Once again I believe the benefits of the speech recognition system is situational, although it is much more useful than the previous minimap feature and can be used in a lot more situations (in fact, speech recognition can benefit cases under most conditions). Also, I occasionally would forget the name of the shape, and would have to select a shape to remember what it's called before using speech recognition and this creates further delays. As such, I believe it would be more beneficial if there's another screen that can be placed in the space around me (like the selection screen) that shows a list of the shapes and their names for quick reference.
column64: Although technique 1 was more interesting and fun overall, technique 2 completes the task faster in a more efficient way. Both techniques makes selecting shapes (including those stacked or behind other shapes) much easier.
column65: Speech recognition requires that you remember the name of the shape specifically, although this could easily be resolved with a list of shape and name references by the side. Point and click could cause fatigue after some time and would have difficulty selecting shapes stacked or behind one another. There is not much to dislike in the minimap feature as it is a fun and innovative method to find shapes. It also serves it's intended purpose well. However, it is not as efficient as the speech recognition method.
column66: A combination of all 3 methods (minimap, point and click, speech recognition) would be the best as they all perform better under different conditions. This would give the user a more versatile range of tools to work with to help them accomplish the task faster. I believe all the features are needed to allow the user to adapt to the situation and select the right tools to complete the shape selection task in the shortest amount of time.

column9: I like the ability to select objects from a list on the right of the mini map since it allows for easy selection of the shapes when they're grouped up. I also liked the mini map itself since it allowed for the search area to be zoomed in on which made it easier to find shapes far away
column10: I think that having to region to mini map before selected a shape could take longer in some cases where the hape is already seen by itself and could be selected without the mini map
column36: This speech technique was very efficient and took a lot less time since I didnt have to select each target by hand. Quite responsive results eventhough it was relying on servers for voice processing.
column37: There were some errors relating to shape names such as pyramid cuboids and it heard keyboard instead of cuboid. I think this could be because cuboid in a scottish accent when speaking english can be misinterperated by voice recognition software as keyboard.
column64: I found using voice for finding shapes was very efficient and for the minimap, i found it very useful on the basis that i needed to select each shae myself since it helped spread out cluttered areas to find the shape i needed
column65: The minimap was a bit clunky to use and using voice would of been way easier to complete the tasks
column66: Just lower server response times in conjunction with more respnsive controls for minimap seletion since there were times it seemed i was pointing at an object but it wouldnt delect.

column9: 刚开始操作不适应，适应后感觉交互很方便很快捷
column10: 有时候右手点选不上，不知道是不是硬件的问题，感觉阻碍了交互过程

column36: 在需要选中多个物体，以及物体有重叠的时候用语音明显更快捷
column37: 需要读出完全准确的英文发音而不支持联想修正单词，导致很多时候选中的时候很浪费时间需要一遍遍重读
column38: 所有的语音识别系统应该都需要支持模糊匹配以提高识别效率
column64: 我喜欢第一种技术里面的交互操作，有玩游戏的爽感；而第二种技术更有效率，却少了趣味性
column65: 第一种技术需要专注度较高，因为像在玩游戏，追求越来越好的完成成绩，玩久了有点累；第二种语音识别功能太拉跨，只能在较为简单的语音交互场景使用
column66: 第一种功能在完成的时候如果有更激昂语音的交互提示可能会体感更好，希望第二种功能有英文语音的模糊匹配功能而不是一昧的追求单词的精确度

column9: it makes objects far away easier to see and objects in dense spaces are easier to spot
column10: sometimes you have to scan the whole are if you cannot already pick out the objects
column11: could be less useful in more complex scenarios
column36: the speech allowed me to find objects that i could not see and the raycast made picking the easiest objects alot faster
column37: sometimes the speech takes multiple attempts
column64:
In difficult cases the speech was the best and sometimes only answer. However it was not as effiecient as the ray cast so the combination of both is more effective.
Technique one was good when you can see where the objects are
column65: Technique one is slow if you cannot see where the objects are
column66: the speech system combined with the first technique would be best because it allows the easy objects to be selected straight away but more difficult to fine or higher quantity objects can also be solved as quickly as possible with the speech feature

column9: i like that using the laser on the left trigger it scans every object it touches and shows it on the minimap, that way we do not have to look at the objects rather we can just look at the minimap to know what objects exist in that space. Especially useful when I was unable to see objects in dense regions. I also like how the minimap freezes when I let go of the left trigger as it means I do not have to hold the laser still. The list of objects showing up on the right of the minimap was very nice as I could see all the objects in overlapped areas, and again I liked how the list of objects would freeze as soon as i let go of the right trigger.
column10: the size of the minimap was not in fixed place, as i had to make sure my right hand was always holding the controller up whilst I was still searching for the objects, which became tiring after some time. Also, the grab button was only working at a specific distance from the object, which makes sense but after practicing a few times I thought I knew how far I would have to be for it to register a grab, but sometimes I would have to click 4 times in order for it to work. I would have liked it even more if there was an option for us to rotate the whole space so that we can view it from a different angle, i.e., if we wanted to view the cluster of objects from the side rather than from the front (still being the same distance away).
column36: the fact that I can tell the system what object to select
column37: how inaccurate the speak recognition is. As well as this the Deselect function doesn't allow for the user to deselect a specific object, it deselects them all, which is not always helpful.
